properties.NAME: Erb-Kumpf House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades of the Kumpf House, excluding the garage.;  Built by Abraham Erb c.1812, one of Waterloos oldest homes.

properties.NAME: Hilliard House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All façades.;  Recognized for its historical and architectural significance.

properties.NAME: Mutual Life Building
properties.DESIG_DETA: The North (King Street) façade, the East (Union Street) façade and the front portion (nearest King Street) of the West façade.

properties.NAME: Post Office
properties.DESIG_DETA: All four façades, the tower and the entire roofline.

properties.NAME: Fenner House
properties.DESIG_DETA: East, North and South façades.

properties.NAME: Nixon House
properties.DESIG_DETA: The North (front), West and the East façades.

properties.NAME: Bellinger-Bean House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All façades, many architecturally significant elements e.g. frieze board and brackets.;  Associated with many prominent local citizens.

properties.NAME: Pumping Station
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades of the building.

properties.NAME: Roschman Button Factory
properties.DESIG_DETA: The North (railway) and the East (Regina Street) façades.

properties.NAME: Reitzel House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades, including the verandah, and the entire roofline of the Craftsman style dwelling.

properties.NAME: Schiel House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades, including the verandah and the entire roofline of the 1898 Queen Anne style dwelling.

properties.NAME: Wissler-Cascaden House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All façades of the house. ;  The interior two-storey front hall.;  The decorative plasterwork on the arches of the house.;  The plaster medallion in entrance hall of the house.

properties.NAME: Snyder-Hahn Building
properties.DESIG_DETA: The front façade of the building with the exception of the electric sign.

properties.NAME: Schavio House
properties.DESIG_DETA: West, North and South façades, excluding the large window at the rear of the South side.

properties.NAME: Market Hotel
properties.DESIG_DETA: Designated to be of historic value and interest.;  Its function as a hotel and later, as an important industrial enterprise, has contributed significantly to the social and business fabric of the community.

properties.NAME: Rummelhardt School
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades of the original stone schoolhouse.

properties.NAME: Train Station
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades, the entire roof line and the interior vaulted ceiling.

properties.NAME: Brubacher Farm House
properties.DESIG_DETA: Mennonite version of the plain Georgian style.;  Historic value and interest as the only early Pennsylvania German stone house, originally built in 1850, still standing on the University of Waterloo campus.

properties.NAME: Elizabeth Ziegler Public School
properties.DESIG_DETA: North, West (Front) and South façades.

properties.NAME: Rudy Farmhouse
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades of this historical rural Waterloo home.

properties.NAME: Seagram Buildings: Buehler Foundry & Maintenance Building
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades of the administration and maintenance buildings.

properties.NAME: Eby House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All façades of the house are designated for architectural and cultural-heritage value.

properties.NAME: Kuntz-Labatt House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All exterior façades of the building.

properties.NAME: Waterloo Hotel
properties.DESIG_DETA: The South (Erb Street) and the West (King Street) façades.

properties.NAME: Elam Martin Farmstead
properties.DESIG_DETA: Main House, Wash House, Doddy House, Schnitz House, Spring House, Smoke House/Outhouse, Wood/Tool Shed, Wagon Shed, Barn, Silo  the first silo attached to the northeast corner of the barn, Corn Crib, Drive Shed, and Butchering Shed.

properties.NAME: Seagram Bonded Warehouse
properties.DESIG_DETA: The West, North and East façades and the remaining interior barrel racking system of the original c. 1878 Bonded Warehouse.

properties.NAME: Kuntz-Eckert House
properties.DESIG_DETA: The West, North and South façades ending at the one storey portion of the building.

properties.NAME: Charlie Voelker House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All façades of the house.;  Designated for historical and architectural significance.
properties.DESCRIPTIO: A Colonial Revival house of Dutch inspiration.

properties.NAME: Snyder-Seagram House
properties.DESIG_DETA: The West (front), North and South façades of the Edwardian house.
properties.DESCRIPTIO: An unusual Edwardian Classical house in parged concrete with matching double-car garage facing Dorset Street.

properties.NAME: Hahn House
properties.DESIG_DETA: West (front) and South façades.

properties.NAME: Molson's Bank
properties.DESIG_DETA: The North, West and East façades.

properties.NAME: Huether Hotel
properties.DESIG_DETA: East exterior façade, excluding all signage, the arched stone entrance, and vaulted ceiling of the original storage cavern, now brewery.

properties.NAME: Bahnsen House
properties.DESIG_DETA: The North and East façades and the interior front entry are designated for cultural heritage purposes.

properties.NAME: Devitt-Voelker House
properties.DESIG_DETA: A combination of architectural influences from the Georgian, Classic and Gothic periods.;  The first designated landmark in the City.
properties.DESCRIPTIO: A Gothic Revival house in the delta where Albert and Fountain Streets meet.

properties.NAME: Good-Shantz House
properties.DESIG_DETA: North, East (Albert Street) and South façades.
properties.DESCRIPTIO: A mid-nineteenth century house transformed into an Italianate farmhouse and set in a grove of Norway spruce, the remnant of Mount Pleasant Farm.

properties.NAME: Carnegie Library
properties.DESIG_DETA: Brick work on all façades and to include all windows on all façades.;  Stained glass window on East side, the front steps, the corner stone at the South East corner marked Carnegie and 1903, bronze Honour Roll on the South façade and the above-ground

properties.NAME: Burkholder-Burkhardt House
properties.DESIG_DETA: Combination of Georgian and Gothic styles.  Windows with numerous small panes and soldier courses over them, ornamental barge boards above central front gable.;  Historical significance to Waterloo as it served as the areas first Evangelical Church, con
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The German Methodist Church, long used as a house, with Pennsylvania-German features and a central Gothic Revival peak.

properties.NAME: Haas House
properties.DESIG_DETA: All of the façades of the original house.
